Package edu.missouristate.taschedulegenerator.algorithm

Class GeneticAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
edu.missouristate.taschedulegenerator.algorithm.GeneticAlgorithm
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, Comparator<int[]>
public class GeneticAlgorithm
extends Object
implements Runnable, Comparator<int[]>
This class represents an independent genetic algorithm that can easily be ran on a new thread. Note: The genetic algorithm will continue to run until the thread it is running on is interrupted.
Author:
Noah Geren

  • Constructor Details

    • GeneticAlgorithm

      public GeneticAlgorithm​(List<TA> tas, List<Activity> activities, CompletableFuture<List<Schedule>> completableFuture) throws NoTAAvailableException
      Create a new genetic algorithm and calculate which activities can be assisted by which TAs.
      Parameters:
      tas - The TAs used for generating schedules.
      activities - The activities used for generating schedules.
      completableFuture - The Future that the results will be returned to after being interrupted.
      Throws:
      NoTAAvailableException - Thrown if there exists an activity for which no TA is available to assist.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the genetic algorithm. This should be called internally by the Thread class.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • crossover

      private void crossover​(int[][] population)
      Combines the genes of each individual with another individual found using tournament selection.
      Parameters:
      population - The population on which crossover should be done.
      See Also:
      selectParent(int[][]), generateOffspring(int[],int[],double), CROSSOVER_RATE

    • selectParent

      private int[] selectParent​(int[][] population)
      Uses tournament selection to select a parent for crossover. Tournament selection returns the best individual from a random subset of the population.
      Parameters:
      population - The population from which the parent should be selected.
      Returns:
      The individual selected to be the parent.
      See Also:
      crossover(int[][]), TOURNAMENT_SIZE

    • generateOffspring

      private void generateOffspring​(int[] parentOne, int[] parentTwo, double exchangeRate)
      Copies genes from parent two into parent one using the provided exchange rate.
      Parameters:
      parentOne - Parent one. This parent's genes will be overwritten.
      parentTwo - Parent two.
      exchangeRate - The rate at when genes should be copied from parent two to parent one. Should be between 0 and 1.

    • mutate

      private void mutate​(int[][] population)
      Mutates (slightly changes) each individual in the provided population.
      Parameters:
      population - The population of individuals that should be mutated.
      See Also:
      getRandomSchedule(), generateOffspring(int[],int[],double), MUTATION_RATE

    • getRandomSchedule

      private int[] getRandomSchedule()
      Generates a random schedule using the tasByActivity map to only select available TAs and a guassian distribution to randomly select the hours assigned.
      Returns:
      A random schedule represented by an integer array. Each pair of indices represent on activity with the first index being the TA's index in tas and the second index being the number of hours assigned.
      See Also:
      tasByActivity, HOURS_STANDARD_DEVIATION

    • calculateScheduleError

      private int calculateScheduleError​(int[] schedule, List<String> errorLog)
      Calculates the a given schedule's error value by finding the sum of weighted scheduling constraint violations. Metrics Used:
      1. If multiple of a TA's activities overlap.
      2. A TA was assigned more/fewer hours than their max hours.
      3. A activity was assigned more/fewer hours than needed.
      4. A single course's activities were split among multiple TAs.
      Parameters:
      schedule - The schedule to find the error value for.
      errorLog - A list of strings that can be used to log error messages to. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The error value associated with the provided schedule.
      See Also:
      SECTION_OVERLAP, ACTIVITY_UNDER_HOURS, ACTIVITY_OVER_HOURS, NOT_ALL_SAME_TA, TA_OVER_HOURS, TA_UNDER_HOURS

    • percentErrorMultiplier

      private double percentErrorMultiplier​(int expected, int actual)
      Returns an error multiplier that accounts for the difference and percent error between expected and actual values.
      Parameters:
      expected - The value that was expected.
      actual - The actual value that was used.
      Returns:
      |expected - actual| + |expected - actual|/expected

    • compare

      public int compare​(int[] s1, int[] s2)
      Compares two schedules using their error value. Also sets the schedule's error value if it isn't already.
      Specified by:
      compare in interface Comparator<int[]>
      Parameters:
      s1 - Schedule one.
      s2 - Schedule two.
      Returns:
      Negative if s1 is better than s2, positive if s2 is better than s1, and 0 if equal.
      See Also:
      calculateScheduleError(int[],java.util.List<java.lang.String>)

    • repair

      private void repair​(int[] schedule)
      Repairs a schedule by looking for common an easily fixable mistakes. Schedule problems fixed:
      • A TA has too many hours in one activity and too few in another
      • Two TAs have an activity with same hours, but switching them would reduce the error value
      Parameters:
      schedule - The schedule to be repaired.
